metadata.title: CVE-2023-42752 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
An integer overflow flaw was found in the Linux kernel. This issue leads tothe kernel allocating `skb_shared_info` in the userspace, which isexploitable in systems without SMAP protection since `skb_shared_info`contains references to function pointers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-42752` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-194-generic - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-194-lowlatency - 3.13.0-194.245
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-246-generic - 4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-246-generic - 4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-246-lowlatency - 4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1124-aws - 4.4.0-1124.130
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1171-azure - 4.15.0-1171.186~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-194.245').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-246.280~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1124.130').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1171.186~14.04.1').
